author: enzagaray
title: NFT MARKETPLACE LATIN AMERICA
description: S'enregistrer dans un nftstore nécessite de valider le compte et pour cela il faut envoyer l'ada et payer une taxe.

f6_assessments.q0: The author of the proposal argues that the cost of the NFTstore registration fee is a problem that needs to be solved and I must say that the description of the problem is a bit confusing to me. It is proposed to address this problem by offering an alternative to paying the fee through "human work". However, I do not find a direct alignment with the objectives of the challenge. So I recommend to the proposer that for future challenges he submit this proposal perhaps in the miscellaneous section or another challenge that aligns more with his proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: Unfortunately, this proposal lacks the minimum elements necessary for evaluating feasibility. Therefore, I would like to offer a series of recommendations to the author of the proposal. (1) Provide us with a section where you tell us about the team, the background of each member, and provide references where external verification can be requested. (2) Regarding the budget, I recommend that it be broken down into identifiable items with a brief description so that the community may evaluate its suitability. (3) Finally, I believe it is necessary to have a section on identified risks as well as the corresponding countermeasures needed to eliminate or reduce those risks.
f6_assessments.q2:
"The auditability section includes a roadmap that the author understands must be completed, as well as milestones that will occur at 3, 6 and 12 months. There is, however, a need to improve the description of success metrics for the community to audit. Instead of saying ""first users,"" it might be more appropriate to indicate the anticipated number of registered users. And so on, to ensure transparency during the implementation process.
"

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims to bring in new cardano users through the NFT space. However, it is not fully clear to me how the proposer intends to onboard new users. If the proposer could elaborate on how this proposal will bring new latin american cardano users into the ecosystem, especially with regards to catalyst, it would greatly strengthen the proposal. Additionally, the proposer mentioned replacing current means of identity verification with humans. However, I do believe that the current automated systems are better because there is no human error involved. Bringing humans into the picture increases the risk of errors and also begins to jeopardize the decentralized nature of the entire system. (score given: 3)
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has not provided any relevant experience that will give voters confidence in their proposal. Under the relevant experience section, the proposer listed an example of how they believed the current identity verification system was bad, but I do not think that that is sufficient experience that will help the proposer succeed in implementing these ideas. If the proposer could add more details about how their experience (work or cardano related) would help them work on this project, it would help the proposal be more effective when voters read it. 

The proposers did, however, include a plan for what they intend to use the funds for. They will use it for marketing purposes and hiring a third-party auditor to examine their project. There is also a decent roadmap that lists the goals of the project over a one year period. It would have been nice for the proposer to include some more details about how they plan to publish the NFT marketplace or how their marketing strategies will bring in new users. (score given: 2)
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has provided good information to audit the progress and success of the proposal. They have the roadmap that the community can use to make sure the project is on track to be completed by the proposed deadlines. However, I would have liked some more elaboration on some details in the measures of success. For example, how many people on the NFT marketplace would constitute "very high traffic?" If the proposer could add some more details, it would greatly strengthen the proposal. (score given: 4)

f6_assessments.q0: The issue being to register a NFT store a small fee has to be paid while sending the ADA for validation. The proposer in the proposal wants to develop a marketplace for Latin Americans where account registration is done by Humans without charging a fee but by involving humans for verification the decentralized element will not apply and again the humans needed to be paid. The proposer hasn't explained how they will be paid without charging a fee
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer haven't provided any details about their past experience or working on any similar related projects and they have provided a rough plan with steps to be taken without an detailed explanation on how it works. It is very unlikely that this proposal will be executed successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: In the proposal the proposer has given a timeline and have provided targets to achieve within the mentioned time. But they haven't provided a detailed budget breakdown which would have helped to understand the expenses and would have helped to audit the development of proposal. Hence the information provided is not enough to track and audit the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a nice concept of NFT market place . The problem statement and the solution in my opinion can be rewritten to articulate and structure the Idea very well. The manual registration as proposer by the team will limit scalability of the platform and in turn limit the Impact of the Projects.
f6_assessments.q1: I like the fact that the budget seem to be only for marketing purposes and the platform seem to be in development already. I have accessed the website provided and there is an NFT section where users can create their own NFT, which is commendable. I believe with the Experience they used in building their currently website , there is the possibility that the team can handle this project.  I would suggest the team read other people's proposal and  see how they can restructure their plan and add all the necessary section and steps to achieve their goal.  There is the definitions of success.
f6_assessments.q2:
The Budget is fair and there are mentions of what the budget will be used for like marketing and publicity , I would suggest the budget should be breakdown so we can see the each of the Items and the allocated Amount .

The public launch date is too close and the timeline to receive this fund is around Feb-March 2022. Please adjust that too.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposition is interesting, and at the same time a bit confusing. The problem statement should be more coherent and relevant to the challenge, but the solution proposed by the proponent is too specific to address some of the challenge's most important questions.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal looks more like an idea than a complete proposal. There is too little information to be able to assess the feasibility of this project, the budget is unclear, there are no KPIs, as well as the roadmap, given very vague.
In terms of knowing who the people involved in the project are, what is mentioned in the proposal description are the names, roles, and time experience of the team members. To increase the likelihood of community consent, I recommend recommending more about your own experience, as well as personal links like Twitter or LinkedIn, so we can build confidence in your recommendations. friend.
So I have rated 1 point for feasibility
f6_assessments.q2:
Since there is no information on budget usage, there is no way to verify if it is well played. The proposal only gives a figure of $25,000 but does not give any explanation on how the capital will be used
Offering roadmaps with 3,6,12 months, but it seems to be more words than concrete actions. Since there is no blueprint, no KPIs or metrics, there is no way to gauge the progress and success of the proposal. Does not give any indicators to be auditable.
Based on the information given, I disagree that this proposal provides us with sufficient information to review its progress.

solution: Une place de marché latino où l'enregistrement du compte est effectué par un travail humain et où il n'y a pas de frais à payer.
experience: Chaque fois que nous devions valider un compte dans une application, nous devions envoyer un ADA et payer les frais. Les ADAs reviennent, la redevance n'est pas
